Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a land habitat, such as a forest, including a variety of plants like trees, grasses, and bushes.
The student can accurately draw a water habitat, such as a pond, including a variety of plants like aquatic weeds and reeds.
The student can include multiple types of animals in the land habitat, such as squirrels, lizards, and ants, showing their diverse locations (e.g., squirrels in trees, ants on the ground).
The student can include various types of animals in the water habitat, such as fish, frogs, and snails, illustrating their positions (e.g., fish swimming, frogs by the edge).
The student can compare the different types of living things found in both habitats by showing distinct groups of organisms and labeling them appropriately.
The student can demonstrate patterns of biodiversity by illustrating clusters of different living things interacting appropriately within each habitat.
CANNOT: Occasionally, the student may forget to label one or two minor plants or animals accurately (e.g., mislabeling a bush as a flowering plant).

Though exhibiting advanced skills, the student might not capture micro-habitats or very small-scale biodiversity differences within the habitat (such as specific areas preferred by certain organisms).
